WorkItem.ClosedComment: DO NOT USE COMMAS AS DECIMAL POINTS. If a value is not a valid PHP numeric (integer or float) then it __will__ be treated as a string
WorkItem.Description:
The COUNTIF calculation fails if the formula operates on decimal values and current LC_NUMERIC locale uses a comma for a decimal mark. The exception message is "Formula Error: Unexpected ,", as if the formula operated on string representation of the value - with decimal commas instead of points.

Attached: a simple test case.
WorkItem.Summary: COUNTIF: calculation fails when using comma for a decimal point

Comments.Message: Do have a look at the attached test case. The value is a valid PHP float but at some point the PHPExcel converts it to a string using current locale.
